alert.note: Alert for Jefferson Davis (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 6:19PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Jefferson Davis and east central Calcasieu Parishes through 645 PM CDT... At 619 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lebleu Settlement, or near Iowa, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake Charles, Westlake, Iowa, Moss Bluff, Buller, Lebleu Settlement and Lacassine. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 32 and 50. Interstate 210 between mile markers 11 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
